Identification_Area.title: Apollo 14 Charged Particle Lunar Environment Experiment (CPLEE)

Modification_Detail.description: Created by the NASA Space Science Data Coordinated Archive.

External_Reference.reference_text: Apollo 14 Preliminary Science Report, NASA SP-272, NASA, Washington, D.C., 1971.
Apollo Scientific Experiments Data Handbook, JSC-09166, NASA TMX-58131, August 1974 (revised April 1976), in Johnson Space Center History Office.

Instrument.name: Apollo 14 Charged Particle Lunar Environment Experiment
Instrument.description: The Apollo 14 Charged Particle Lunar Environment Experiment (CPLEE) measured the energy spectra of low-energy charged particles striking the lunar surface by observing the fluxes of electrons and ions with energies from 40 eV to 20 keV in two directions: local vertical and 60 degrees from vertical toward lunar west. The primary purpose of the experiment was to examine plasma particles originating from the Sun and the low-energy particle flux in the magnetic tail of the Earth.
